name: Snowstorm
description: DHTML Snowstorm! JavaScript-based snow for web pages. Making it snow on Koken since 2015.

snowStorm_mobile.label: Exclude on mobile
snowStorm_mobile.info: Snow is likely to be bad news for mobile phones CPUs (and batteries.) Enable at your own risk.

snowStorm_flakemax.label: Max flakes on screen
snowStorm_flakemax.info: Limit total amount of snow made (falling + sticking)

snowStorm_flakemaxactive.label: Max flakes active
snowStorm_flakemaxactive.info: Limit amount of snow falling at once (less = lower CPU use)

snowStorm_animationinterval.label: Update interval
snowStorm_animationinterval.info: Theoretical miliseconds per frame measurement. 20 = fast + smooth, but high CPU use. 50 = more conservative, but slower.

snowStorm_gpu.label: Use hardware acceleration
snowStorm_gpu.info: Enable transform-based hardware acceleration, reduce CPU load.

snowStorm_flakebottom.label: Flake bottom
snowStorm_flakebottom.info: Integer for Y axis snow limit, 0 or null for full-screen snow effect

snowStorm_followmouse.label: Follow mouse
snowStorm_followmouse.info: Snow movement can respond to the user's mouse

snowStorm_color.label: Snowflake color
snowStorm_color.info: Remember: Don't eat (or use?) yellow snow!

snowStorm_char.label: Flake character
snowStorm_char.info: Character used for the flake. See http://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_utf_dingbats.asp for reference.

options.label: Six petalled black and white florette

snowStorm_snowstick.label: Stick to bottom?
snowStorm_snowstick.info: Whether or not snow should 'stick' at the bottom. When off, will never collect.

snowStorm_targetelement.label: Target element
snowStorm_targetelement.info: Element which snow will be appended to (null = document.body) - can be an element ID eg. 'myDiv', or a DOM node reference

snowStorm_usemelteffect.label: Melting effect
snowStorm_usemelteffect.info: When recycling fallen snow (or rarely, when falling), have it 'melt' and fade out if browser supports it

snowStorm_twinkeleffect.label: Flicker effect
snowStorm_twinkeleffect.info: Allow snow to randomly 'flicker' in and out of view while falling

snowStorm_positionfixed.label: Snow Position
snowStorm_positionfixed.info: true = snow does not shift vertically when scrolling. May increase CPU load, disabled by default - if enabled, used only where supported

snowStorm_pixelposition.label: Pixel position
snowStorm_pixelposition.info: Whether to use pixel values for snow top/left vs. percentages. Auto-enabled if body is position:relative or targetElement is specified.

snowStorm_freezeonblur.label: Stop when not in focus
snowStorm_freezeonblur.info: Only snow when the window is in focus (foreground.) Saves CPU.

snowStorm_flakeleftoffset.label: Left margin space
snowStorm_flakeleftoffset.info: Left margin/gutter space on edge of container (eg. browser window.) Bump up these values if seeing horizontal scrollbars.

snowStorm_flakerightoffset.label: Right margin space
snowStorm_flakerightoffset.info: Right margin/gutter space on edge of container

snowStorm_flakewidth.label: Flake width
snowStorm_flakewidth.info: Max pixel width reserved for snow element

snowStorm_flakeheight.label: Flake height
snowStorm_flakeheight.info: Max pixel height reserved for snow element

snowStorm_vmaxx.label: Maximum X velocity
snowStorm_vmaxx.info: Maximum X velocity range for snow

snowStorm_vmaxy.label: Maximum Y velocity
snowStorm_vmaxy.info: Maximum Y velocity range for snow

snowStorm_zindex.label: Stacking order
snowStorm_zindex.info: CSS stacking order (z-index) applied to each snowflake
